lamparski.areabase.widgets

Class SubjectExpandableListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseExpandableListAdapter
      • lamparski.areabase.widgets.SubjectExpandableListAdapter

  • public class SubjectExpandableListAdapter
extends BaseExpandableListAdapter
    A android.widget.BaseExpandableListAdapter implementation that deals with the census data -- it's the Controller bit of SubjectViewFragment's MVC flow.
    Author:
    filip
    See Also:
    android.widget.BaseExpandableListAdapter, SubjectViewFragment, Dataset

      • getGroupView

        public View getGroupView(int groupPosition,
                boolean isExpanded,
                View convertView,
                ViewGroup parent)
        Generates a top-level view of the list -- a dataset title bar.
        Parameters:
        groupPosition - The index of the dataset in the array
        isExpanded - Whether the sub-list (ie the dataset) has been expanded
        convertView - Optionally a recyclable view, however it may not be the one we want
        parent - The list view
        Returns:
        A complete view

      • getChildView

        public View getChildView(int groupPosition,
                int childPosition,
                boolean isLastChild,
                View convertView,
                ViewGroup parent)
        Examines the current dataset and decides which type of list item to display
        Parameters:
        groupPosition - The index of the dataset in the array
        childPosition - The index of the data item in the dataset
        isLastChild - Whether the current item is the last child (not really useful here)
        convertView - Optionally a recyclable view, however it may not be the one we want; it just gets passed down to the functions that actually generate views
        parent - The list view
        Returns:
        Depending on whether the dataset is graphable and the child position, either a dataset item or a chartlink.
        See Also:
        lamparski.areabase.widgets.SubjectExpandableListAdapter#getRegularChildView(int, int, boolean, android.view.View, android.view.ViewGroup), SubjectExpandableListAdapter#getChartLinkChildView(int, android.view.View, android.view.ViewGroup)

      • isChildSelectable

        public boolean isChildSelectable(int groupPosition,
                        int childPosition)

      • isGraphable

        public boolean isGraphable(int groupPosition)
        Determines if the dataset is possible to represent as a graph. Currently, it just looks at whether it has more than 1 item, however it can later use an exclusion list or other rules to determine graphability
        Parameters:
        groupPosition - The index of the dataset in the array
        Returns:
        true if the dataset can be represented on a graph
